```{r, eval=FALSE}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Argument x should be numeric")
  } else if (length(x) == 1) {
    stop("Z scores cannot be computed for length 1 vectors")
  }
  
  z = mean(x) / sd(x)
  
  z
}
```



```{r, error=TRUE}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  out_df =
    tibble(
      mean = mean_x,
      sd = sd_x
    )
  
  return(out_df)
  
}

mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## Check stuff using a simulation

```{r}
sim_df =
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(30, 10, 5)
  )

sim_df |> 
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

Simulation function to check sample mean and sd.

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(samp_size, true_mean = 4, true_sd = 12) {
  
  sim_df =
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(samp_size, true_mean, true_sd)
  )

  out_df = 
    sim_df |> 
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
  )
  
  return(out_df)
  
}

sim_mean_sd(samp_size = 30, true_mean = 4, true_sd = 12)
sim_mean_sd(true_mean = 4, true_sd = 12, samp_size = 30)

```


Run this a lot of times ...

```{r}
sim_mean_sd(30)
```


run this using a for loop? 

```{r}
output = vector("list", 1000)

for (i in 1:1000) {
  
  output[[i]] = sim_mean_sd(30)
}

#output


bind_rows(output) |> 
  summarize(
    ave_mean = mean(mean),
    sd_mean = sd(mean))
```


Can I use `map` instead?

```{r}
sim_res =
  tibble(
    iter = 1:1000
  ) |> 
  mutate(samp_res = map(iter, sim_mean_sd, samp_size = 30)) |> 
  unnest(samp_res)
```

Could I try different sample sizes?

```{r}
sim_res =
  expand_grid(
    n = c(10, 30, 60, 100),
    iter = 1:1000
  ) |> 
  mutate(samp_res = map(n, sim_mean_sd)) |> 
  unnest(samp_res)
```


```{r}
sim_res |> 
  group_by(n) |> 
  summarize(
    se = sd(mean)
  )
```

```{r}
sim_res |> 
  filter(n == 100) |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = mean)) +
  geom_histogram()
```
